description.narrative: The Power of Nutrition is working with Chatham House, the Royal Institute of International Affairs, to deliver a ground-breaking research project designed to help build greater public and private sector support for tackling undernutrition. Chatham House is a leading policy research institute. For this project they will explore - for the first time - how undernutrition impacts global businesses and will seek to demonstrate how improving access to nutrition represents a rewarding long-term investment

This project will lead to the production of a detailed, and highly researched report - supported by carefully targeted events - which will inform, engage and mobilise key business stakeholders from a wide range of corporate sectors. This activity will be designed to: - Raise the profile of undernutrition and its impact among business stakeholders; - Develop a clear narrative around all the ways in which undernutrition impacts businesses and undermines market growth and development; - Act as a catalyst that will help and encourage businesses to take a more active role in efforts to reduce undernutrition; - Provide a platform for ongoing engagement with and by private sector actors interested in taking a more active role tackling undernutrition.
